channel.title: opentelemetry on Nicole van der Hoeven
channel.description: Recent content in opentelemetry on Nicole van der Hoeven

item.title: Introduction to eBPF With Grafana Beyla (Grafana Office Hours #25)
item.description:
Nikola Grčevski, Principal Software Engineer at Grafana Labs, gives us an introduction to eBPF with Grafana Beyla. We discuss what is eBPF, how you can use it to auto-instrument applications, and how to get started with Beyla. eBPF observability is all the rage because we all want automagical instrumentation– but does it live up to that promise? Nikola’s here to tell us what eBPF can and can’t do, and where he’d like to take Beyla next.

Links

  • Grafana Beyla repo
  • Grafana Beyla docs
  • Application Observability docs

item.title: Getting Started with OpenTelemetry (Grafana Office Hours #23)
item.description: Principal Engineer Juraci Paixão Kröhling talks to my colleague Paul Balogh and me about getting started with OpenTelemetry: what it is, why everyone’s talking about it, and how to instrument your systems and improve their reliability and observability. Juraci is a contributor to open source projects like Jaeger and OpenTelemetry.

item.title: How to Get Started with Tempo (Grafana Office Hours #22)
item.description:
Grafana Labs Principal Engineer and Tempo maintainer Joe Elliot talks about how to get started with Tempo, what distributed tracing is, and why TraceQL is cool. He is joined by Developer Advocates Nicole van der Hoeven and Paul Balogh.

Resources

  • Getting started with Tempo (video)
  • Grafana Tempo repo
  • Grafana Tempo docs
  • The Tempo category on the Grafana community forum
  • Video playlist for Grafana Tempo
  • Distributed tracing with Grafana Cloud k6 (Grafana Office Hours video)
